newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-PIPER FINED, BANNED AFTER POSITIVE DRUGS TEST.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-PIPER FINED, BANNED AFTER POSITIVE DRUGS TEST.

text.p: Warwickshire wicket-keeper Keith Piper was fined 500 pounds ($830) and banned for one match after failing a drugs test, the English county side said on Wednesday.
Piper, a former England A player, tested positive for cannabis after the entire team was tested on Monday.

"Both the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) and the club take a serious view of the offence, believing that it is essential for the clean image of the game of cricket to be protected," Warwickshire said in a statement.

"The player has agreed to give the club a signed undertaking that he will not be using the drug in future. The club has also offered to provide counselling to the player for this problem as necessary."
The tests were carried out after the county's former all-rounder Paul Smith was banned from professional cricket for 22 months by the ECB earlier this month for using cocaine.
